title: How to heal myself from narcissistic abuse - Quora

response.answer_text: Okey i’m going to sum it all up everything that you need to know and the process to move forward. Just follow the steps and you will break free. Early Stages of Relationship-Love Bombing symptoms: They portray themselves as victims, basically sharing all the sad stories that happened to them, how they got mistreated and abused by people, with this method they gain your sympathy and connect you even deeper to helping them, loving them and also trying to fix them.They are too good to be true.In the first conversations you connect deeply to them, basically they will mirror everything about your character traits, style, interests and it will feel basically like they are the closest person to you character from day 1.You are the best thing that happened to them ever, no one understands them as you do, they got abused by everyone else and you finally are their savior.The biggest red flag that the victims should be on the lookout for is Parental Neglect or childhood abuse, if they share those things with you, especially too soon, run for your life, it won't end up well for you.They will love bomb you, raise you on a pedesta, basically shower you with compliments, and every compliment or feeling you give to them they will answer back with more of the same. This is the stage where they hook you up to their validation, attention, adulation, and admiration.They are very interested in you, from the first few conversations, asking you everything about yourself, how your day was, basically they will give you an amount of abnormal attention early on, initiating the conversations first, talking to you for hours daily, they are gaining your trust in this phase and getting you hooked to the game.Unbearable mood swings, in one moment they are all lovely, the other moment they just go exploding on you, you feel like you are walking on eggshells due to their unpredictable mood swings, they are basically sucking and draining your energy alongside with your esteem.They cause drama out of the blue, since drama brings excitement and to see how much you are willing to tolerate and with how much they are able to get away with, they daily cause drama for no reason and then apologize telling you they were overthinking, basically you don’t know what you are going to expect for the next moment, that’s their manipulation technique to get you even more hooked to their game.They shower you with all attention, adulation, emotions, love, care, they are like babies they care way too much way to early, and expect you to answer back with the same things, that’s the part where they try to connect you to their Empathy.Extremely sexual on the first meeting or conversation, they will try to hook you to their game with sexuality and if that does not work they will be emotional and lovely, they switch way too quick from manic to depressive state, basically today they will be sexual and tomorrow tell you off to see how much they can get away with, and how much you are going to insist for them to stay with you.Late Stages of Relationship-Devalue and Discard symptoms: All the attention, adulation, admiration, care is vanished they are cold and distant.Everything you do irritates them, even the jokes that they used to laugh at, or the things that you enjoyed together.You are never enough for anything that you do, they keep dropping sarcasm on every sentence.They get bored with you, since they possess no Empathy and a really low boredom tolerance level.You see their true face after 2–3 months, that everything was an act from them, the person that you thought they were does not exist, it’s an illusion presented by them, their mask or facade drops off since acting takes lots of energy from them.They start to devalue after the love bombing.You feel like you are walking on eggshells, you want their attention, love and care and they withhold their feelings, they withhold everything, you try to search for answers they don’t give you any clear answers, just dull and cold answers, never initiating the contact first, lies flying all over your face, they tell you they are bored, every time you ask for answers, you will get none, you are getting tired losing energy, you don’t know what to expect from this relationship, all the thoughts going on in your head you want some kind of closure, where they give you as little to hang in there.When you try to raise an opinion or ask the relationship to be a two way street, asking them why they changed, or where is the old person you once knew, calling them on their actions and lies, they refuse everything, further manipulating you with methods like:1. Gaslighting: basically refusing everything that you are saying, they would slap you today and tomorrow tell you they didn’t do it, since they know that you wont leave easy they have tested you and your patience, and they know you got a deep connection to them with empathy, they make you doubt yourself and your vision.2. Stone Walling: You ask a question about where are their feelings, she switches the topic and never answers, you ask a question about what they feel, they tell you they do not know, you never get a straight answer.3. Silent Treatments: Every time you call them on their actions this is the cruelest method that they can use,they basically vanish or give you the ghosting or the cold shoulder,they vanish for days,weeks,months,years by answering none of your calls or messages,you don’t know what in the heck happened everything seemed so good,the silent treatment time increases much more when you call them on their actions and ask them for their empathy,you will feel ignored,shattered,in pain,in sorrow etc,then just when you try to move on with your life they re-appear like nothing happened and pick up the things where you left them off even doe if they went off for months or years,With this technique they will escape any responsibility for their actions,ignorance is their biggest weapon-They are giving you a message of:My dear object if you dare to call me on my actions-lies-manipulations i will give you my silence because you don’t deserve my words,since you are a simple toy to me,i played you from day 1 and if you dare to rebel or see through that mask i will ignore you,because i know i’m lying,i’m manipulating,i just simply don’t care because you are my possession and my object,you always were,you let me walk away with all that,so you are going to allow me to walk away once again like back in the time’’4. Projection: Basically when you try to rise up your opinion they switch the blame to you playing the victim card telling you that you are overthinking stuff even though you are sure 100% they did that thing and you end up apologizing to them for the things you never did,because they know deep down inside how much they abuse you no matter what they do you will always stay,they are sure of it because they have tested you early on.What is the reality for the Narcissist. They are your typical Con Artists who received:Emotional Neglect,Childhood Trauma,Emotional Abuse from their parents their whole life.They daily feel internal insecurities,internal conflict,they feel emptiness,they have the void,they see the black hole,they feel worthless no matter what they do etc.The whole childhood abuse caused them lack of Empathy because they were never loved,respected,valued,appreciated from their parents to begin with.They are unable to love anyone including themselves,they hate themselves so that answers all of your question.If someone constantly hates himself/herself so much he will never be able to love someone else.And if you love him/her you are basically a loser because no one can love them because they feel like they always failed in life,that’s their typical mentality.To ease their internal insecurities they manipulate the whole people around them by a fake persona basically faking everything about themselves and presenting to the public a perfect image of a caring,lovely,charming character.While they manipulate the crowd they gather up Admiration,Attention,Adulation,Validation basically to regulate their self esteem which is a temporary fix.No matter what they are your typical wounded child who never grew up emotionally,their emotional level is stuck at their childhood trauma period with one word the period of abuse.With all being said no matter how good the source of supply is they will sooner or later get bored since they possess a really low boredom tolerance level.They tend to hit on victims that possess high levels of Empathy or Empaths,because they are vulnerable and they are easy to be charmed and manipulated.Before the LB-DV-DI process they will start to test the new victim causing drama out of the blue,since drama bring excitement and everything that’s new is exciting.They will cause drama out of the blue and see with how much they are able to walk away,if you leave them walk away with everything that gives them the green light that you possess high levels of empathy and you are a long term source of supply however if you resist their attempts they will discard you early on and move to the next source of supply.They are your typical druggies searching for Fuel aka their fix.If you passed their whole tests the cycle starts.They follow a predictable relationship pattern of LB-DV-DI.LB-rising the victim on the pedestal making him her feel special,telling them all the stuff they need to her while they mirror the victim aka shape shifting to the victims character traits or copying the victim,with one word making the victim fall in love with themselves.This is the closest the NPD will ever get to feel love,Idealization aka Love Bombing is a form of infatuation or obsession with their possession in this case the victim,they are obssessed with their new doll or object they want that so bad.A NPD enters the relationship to fill his/er void pulling all the weight to the shoulders of the victim with one word.They seek for the impossible basically wanting the other people to fix them or fill their emptiness. No matter what others do they will never be able to fill that emptiness because the problem is them not the other people around.After a period of time the void will be back in and they will start to think as maybe the new victim was not special after all since the void is still there,basically the boredom starts to kick in and they will start to Devalue,once the Devalue starts there is no turning back.Devalue-Basically it can happen gradually or suddenly when they get bored or called on their actions,once they start to devalue they start to groom new sources of supplies switching all their energy and time to someone else since it takes them a lot to manipulate new people,it’s a whole new different challenge especially the people that are careful with sharing their empathy.They will pull back and suddenly switch all the attention from you to someone else.The victim will be left in vain not knowing what happened,what did they do,how it happened etc.The victim starts to search for answers they will totally or completely ignore the victims attempts further more manipulating the victim with methods like:Gaslighting-Basically when the victim calls them on their actions they will totally deny their actions taking no responsibility and telling the victim that they are going crazy and they never did tho’s actions:They would slap you today and tell you tomorrow they never did it the victim will basically apologize for the things that they never did.Why is it easy to Gaslighten?Because they have tested you early on threatening you that they are going to leave with one word and you stood by their side,you showed them in one way or another that you won’t leave easy no matter what and that you are going to keep fighting for that person. So once they start to gaslighten they won’t have a problem with it because no matter what they do you will just suck it up and continue to stay by their side and you will fight for them even if it means losing your whole dignity to them.With one word they are using your vulnerabilities as a weakness and trying to turn you into Lunacy with their games and enjoying it to the fullest.Once the devalue starts to kick is you have been already replaced they never discard they will shelf you,being replaced means that the new victim is feeding them Positive Fuel and Excitement while you are the boring guy or the side kick,they won’t ignore you completely they will give you as little as possible to hang in there since you will start to search for answers and you will feed them Fuel with any Positive/Negative reaction they will feel important.Silent Treatments-They like to combine gaslightening with silent treatments with one word.Once they are called on their actions they will basically neutralize your attempts giving you the prolonged silent treatments since they already know that you are aware of whats going on.With this they are giving you a simple message of’’My dear object if you dare to stand up for yourself i will give you my silence and withhold everything that feel’t good on the love bombing phase including:Love,care,affection,attention,value,respect,appreciation etc.Their silence will increase the more the victim calls them on their actions and the more they start to search for answers.The more the victim craves for a closure the less that they are going to give it to them and the more the victim starts to crave for answers the less they are going to give that to the victim.They will never give you a closure or answers because you are an object and you don’t deserve them and they know deep down inside that if they confuse you,you will with one word search more for answers and you will feed them more Fuel and they will finally feel important belittling you,that shows how insecure tho’s individuals are.Projection-Another manipulation technique they will basically project their whole insecurities to you telling you that you are overthinking etc and you are going lunacy.You will end up apologizing profusely for calling them on their actions.Stone Wall-It’s a technique used by Sociopaths also the NPDS like to use it a lot with one word once they get asked for a specific question for ex:Do you still feel what you feel’t before?Do you have feelings,what happened what changed?They will immediately change the topic or switch the topic to something else leaving you even more confused you will never get answers.Emotional Withholds-They will withhold emotionally every time they get called on their actions basically to punish you while you are craving for their attention,affection,love,care etc.Why is it so hard for the victim to move forward? They got you addicted to their attention,love,care,validation,while they fooled you or manipulated you,where you thought they genuinely feel’t for you.Your whole self worth,self esteem,self respect,self value,self love is dependent on them,from the abuse they put you through.They are the bad friend to you who gets a good friend addicted to drugs,you are having severe withdrawal symptoms while they are withholding everything that feel’t good for you including:emotions,attention,love,care etc.Your self esteem is shattered from the abuse that they put you through.You doubt your own vision,your sanity,your abilities,your beauty, your character from the trauma that they put you through manipulating with gaslighting,stone walling,emotional withholds,emotional blackmail,grooming,projections,mirroring etc etcIt happened so fast and suddenly you are confused and you don’t know what happened,you didn’t see it coming you were flying high on Cloud 9 while they suddenly dropped you on the ground when you didn’t expect it.You can’t accept the fact that they fooled you or manipulated you since day 1,it’s a really hard to swallow pill.You have mixed feelings of anger and love for him you can’t difference whats going on.There is hope inside of you that they will see their mistakes and change,you believe that the love that you are giving him is stronger then anything and you can change them and overcome this madness,you are basically reflecting your own emotions of sorrow,sadness,anger,grief.You loved this person genuinely and feelt for him from the deepth of your heart while they never loved you neither cared about you,all they cared about was what they could gain from you basically NS(Any form of admiration,attention,validation,adulation).There is a battle going on with your mind and body,trying to make sense of what happened,and you can never find the answers,because they make no sense at all.They never provided you closure,because they know how much effect that have in your life,so they wanna confuse you further more,or leave the option to Hoover themselves back in when they feel like.You let them surpass all your boundaries,you did whatever they asked you to do,you were the sweetest person on the planet,this caused you to shatter your self love,self esteem,self respect,self value and self care,you don’t possess anymore your old character you are just a shadow hidding in their back.If you head a chance to show them how much you love them,you would have even ripped your heart off for that person,while they never cared.You are surrounding yourself with questions like:Did he really loved me?Did i mean anything to him?How easy it was for him to move on like nothing happened,after all tho’s things that we head together and after all tho’s promises?Is it my fault?What could i have done differently?What does the other person possess more then i do that they are in the relationship with the NPD?Do i look that terrible,i mean if i head done my best they would have still been with me in the relationship right?What did i do wrong?The answer to all of your questions is simple NO,you didn’t do anything wrong,you have to know that you are dealing with an immature kid at the end of the day,who never grew up emotionally because of the childhood trauma they head,they don’t possess any Empathy,they can’t connect to people neither love them,since they have no idea what Love even means,so you have to convince yourself that you are the mature person and you have to walk away from them,you don’t need to fix anyone neither help anyone so they can love you,it’s not your job,you don’t either need toxic people in your life,you need someone stable who is stable with their feelings and accepts you the way you are,you don’t neither need to punish them,because they are already punished by life,it’s immature to seek revenge from a kid. HOW TO MOVE FORWARD? Accept the fact that you got fooled and manipulated.Accept the fact that the person never loved you,cared about you,respected you or valued you.Accept the fact that you never loved him,but you loved his mask or facade an illusion that he presented to you since day 1.Accept the fact that you did your best and no one could have done better the problem is them not you.Accept the fact that you deserve better,because you are human and you have rights not a monkey on their harem.Start regaining everything back by working on yourself,otherwise no one will do that for you,if you don’t bring yourself up no one will be able to bring you up.Take it as you are on a drug abuse rehab,the moment you give up to your feelings you are back to square 1,and all the effort will be gone and vanished while you are half way to get clean and sober.Accept the fact that you don’t need revenge,because that would only hurt you not them,revenge will make you no different then they are,with that they would turn you to them,soul sucking vampires,accept the fact that you are the mature person in here.Go out distract yourself have a wonderful time,listen to some rock n roll go crazy,and forget about them for your own sake and sanity.Go full No Contact cutting everything from them including social media and number,feel blessed that it ended and God saved you on the right moment from this person,it could have been much worst and they could have hurt you even more.God gives us the people that we need not the ones that we want,this was the most difficult test that he gave you,and if he removed this person from your life he head a strong reason behind that,accept the fact that what comes from God is always welcomed,and you don’t posses the strength to question his decision neither change his decision,he will give you the right person when you last to none expect it,have some faith and believe.THE LESSONS YOU SHOULD LEARN FROM THIS EXPERIENCE: Do not trust people easily,it takes a really long time to trust someone.Do not empathize with everyone,be smart to share your empathy with the right people.Being nice to people is good,but that does not mean you should be someones doormat so they can abuse you.Do not allow anyone to abuse you in any way,if they do you walk away without confrontations,because they ain’t worth of your kindness or energy.If someone cheats or lies walk away without a single thought do not hope,because if they do it once they will do it again,live by a rule of:Fool me once shame on you,fool me twice shame on me.Learn to judge people from their actions not their background or personality disorders or words,who cares if he has BPD,ASPD,NPD or Psychopathy,you ain’t no one to help no one you are not a professional psychologist neither a psychiatrist,even they lack helping them neither an Angel from God or Mother Mary.Learn to help yourself firstly then people,if you don’t love yourself respect yourself or value yourself you can’t love no one else period.Learn to walk away from Toxic People,because life experiences help us grow as characters and make us mature individuals.Learn that no one can hurt you as soon as you don’t allow them to,it’s on your hand not theirs.Give people what they deserve,if they treat you like shit you answer back with the same things.Do not try to make sense of the none sense,do not drop yourself low enough to understand people with personality disorders,they will drag you to their level and turn you to lunacy,do not overthink just live for the moment.Blame yourself and apologize to yourself profusely for letting that person abuse you,he does not deserve an apology from you,your inner self does.Do not try to ask Empathy from a Predator ever,It’s like walking with your both legs on a Wolf Lair and expecting them to understand you while you beg,cling,plead for the Predators empathy asking him to love you and never hurt you,Will he be able to understand tho’s things,start asking yourself?If you do walk on that lair,i would blame you not the wolves,because you are an easy prey,it’s a cruel world out there if you act weak or vulnerable to predators they will hurt you and care less,and you are the one to blame.Learn to look at things how they are,not how you want them to be,learn when you are dealing with predators to think with your head not with your emotions or feelings,knowing the truth and acting with feelings that’s stupidity,Basically your mind is clouded by your heart and you can’t see neither difference whats real and whats not,that’s a big no,when your dealing with people that have no clue what Empathy means.How do you hurt a narcissist? Do not take any revenge at all,let them be who they are,because taking revenge from an immature kid makes you as narcissistic as they are.Walk away from them completely,going full No Contact(cutting everything off including their number and social media networks).Do not allow them to contact you on anything,because they know your weaknesses no matter what they will manipulate you again and drag you to the game,if they manipulated you since day 1 they will again do it no problem.If you see them on the road,the are Lord Voldemort to you,they don’t exist on your dictionary,they are dead people thin air to you,ignore them completely and walk away.If you allowed the option for them to Hoover and they already did,ignore them completely,that will drive them mad,when you ignore them you don’t do it to get them mad but you do it for your own good and safety.Do not,beg,plead for them to take you back,apologize to yourself profusely for letting them abuse you,you deserve self love,self respect,self value.Be the mature one to learn to walk away from toxic people in your life,no matter how hard it is you should learn that.You are no one to save them,neither help them or change them,we have professionals to do that thing,and you ain’t one.You say i love him,you should always remember that mature love is built on respect,value,care and love,not codependency and rescuing people so they can love you,you ain’t mother Mary neither an Angel from God to rescue someone,if it means you will ruin your whole life and be enslaved to them.Make peace with your inner self and mind,convince yourself that you got lied and manipulated,the person you knew never existed it was just an illusion presented by them.Fight with your inner self no matter how bad you try to take revenge stop yourself,because the revenge will only hurt you not them,they possess no Empathy neither do they care,the revenge will turn you to a terrible person someone that you are not basically to them,leave them be because they are immature kids,you can’t take revenge from a kid that slapped you,because that makes you as narcissistic as them and as immature as them.Do not trust them on any occasion,they are Con Artists even if they promise they will change,because they wont,a person that lied you once and manipulated you once will always do it no matter what.Go outside spend time with your friends,enjoy your life that’s the best revenge that you can give them,basically not caring at all,showing them that you can continue without them,and showing them that you took your life back,you got successful with your life,you are an independent person standing on your legs,and your whole self worth ain’t dependent on them,life is too beautiful and short to feed yourself with hate or revenge for someone(no matter what they did,because it shows immaturity).Convince yourself that they ain’t your friends,neither an enemy to deserve an revenge from you,you don’t give revenge to someone that has no value on your eyes,you don’t take revenge from thin air,because they ain’t worth of your energy neither of your valuable time.Learn to love yourself again,taking your esteem back,include yourself with positive people who make you laugh and spend the best time of your life with them.Always follow up this code in life,if someone breaks your trust once they will always do it,you leave without arguing or confronting when they do,always follow up this quote’’Fool me once shame on you,fool me twice shame on me.You will go through hard withdrawal symptoms,you will burn your brain and body seeking revenge that’s normal,do not give up,do not give yourself up,take it as you are in a rehab,because if you do they will win,if you learn to walk away’’They might have won a few battles but you will win the war in the end’’Stay blessed because good things are waiting for you on the future,God gives us the people that we need not the ones that we want,if he removed this toxic person from your life he knew why he did it,what comes from God always remember that is most welcomed,if you go against his will you will hurt yourself and no one else.Learn to never share your Empathy with the wrong people,being nice to someone that deserves it is cool,but that does not mean that you should be someones doormat,give people what they deserve if they don’t deserve your words you feed them your silence.Once you disconnect form this person once and for all you take everything back,his/her hoover will be not welcomed at all,you will learn that you did yourself a big favor and that was the best decision you took for your life,you will learn that God blessed you with the most difficult test in your life and you passed it without a problem,you will come back in here,being surprised laughing your ass off telling me that i can’t believe i wasted so much of my energy and time to take revenge from this worthless person,convince yourself that the best revenge that you will take from them is standing up for yourself and moving forward with your life,they don’t deserve your anything,including your revenge.Why do Narcissists Run Away? Well a Narcissist is an immature kid trapped on that adult body and mindset who never grew up emotionally,they lack Empathy they can’t love anyone including themselves because of the childhood trauma. So they trick the victim or charm the victim to receive NS(Narcissistic Supplies)which will ease their constant pain,emptiness and insecurities until they get bored and they start grooming other victims.A narcissist most likely will run away when the significant other starts to get serious about the relationship and asks them to make commitment,a kid is unable to make commitment not with that emotional level,asking a kid about commitment is like telling him/her to grow up lets say from 4 yo to hit 20 you will scare the kid and he/she is going to bail away. The narcissist is unable to love so they can’t commit like normal individuals.The other case scenario might be that they got bored of you or you possess a threat to their safety so they will bail away before you open your mouth,refusing everything that they did and making you look like the crazy guy. How do you combat passive aggression from the Narcissist? By not combating it at all,that’s the only way out. -When they give you their Silence or the so called Silent Treatment they are basically degrading you or giving you a message of’’You don’t deserve my words so i will give you my silence.You my mere object if you dare to call me on my actions/lies/manipulations/boredom i will give you my silence and withhold everything that feel’t good for you because i played you since day 1 i never loved you,cared about you,appreciated you as a human being,neither valued you. -They are expecting you to react in any way positive or negative any reaction from you would feed them fuel. So the only way out is not to play the game,because if you play their game,with their rules you will lose no matter what.Basically just go with their silence and move forward,move forward for your own good not to punish them when they come back Hoovering.You don’t need to punish a immature wounded child who refuses to play because you confronted them with the reality,they are already punished.They are shallow immature individuals. -The passive aggression starts when you call them on their actions/lies/manipulations or when they simply get bored because they are unable to Empathize or feel anything genuinely they fake everything,so no matter how hard you try you will always fail. -They already found new supplies,new faces on the block,everything that’s new for them is exciting while you are the old wounded toy who they sucked you dry.They crave on attention,adulation,admiration,validation(NS)and basically on Excitement and Drama.They simply got bored of you so they are keeping you as a back up the new supply feeds them high octane fuel while any positive/negative fuel from you would be always welcomed,they are keeping you there as an old object,confused,in pain,in sorrow. -So start asking yourself if someone totally ignores you and gives you their silence are they worth the chase?We need to learn to judge people from their actions,if they treat you like shit you have to answer back with the same things that’s how this world works. -Just continue with your life find someone who really loves you the way you are,they fooled you and you already know who they are,just find the inner strength to move forward that’s the only way out. -Find someone who considers you a priority not an option.You need to be a priority,and if someone considers you an option and is punishing you with their silence you need to move forward.Because that shows lack of love,appreciation,value,commitment,respect. Why does the Narcissist get jealous of the Victim? Let me tell you the difference between the Normal Individuals jealousy versus the Narcissists jealousy. The NPD gets jealous because he views you as his or her possession with one word object. So imagine a kid playing with his new toy and another kid trying to snipe his toy,he would start to attack the other kid and tear him apart just for that single toy,not because he loves the toy but because he feels that the toy is his possession and because the other kid wants it also.The normal or the emotionally mature individual who knows how to love,appreciate,value,respect,care about the significant other gets jealous because of the fear that they are going to lose their beloved one,because they love their significant other,they feel lucky that they have the significant other,they appreciate their significant other as a valuable person and as a perfect human being,they are connected to the significant other with their heart,emotions and Empathy.That is the normal jealousy of love in difference with the possessive jealousy of the Narcissist.A survivor is your perfect figure of success.All the survivors out there have my everlasting respect,survivors are warriors who entered the battlefield and fought to the last moment to get out alive from the battlefield,their scars are medal of honors.A warrior enters the battlefield to get out alive and unharmed his fire and will,will help him to achieve tho’s things.Your survivor is not your typical coward who enters the battlefield to die and lose the battle or to give up early wrecking the whole army.The survivor knows that once he is in the middle of the battlefield he has 2 choices,1 to give himself up into the hands of enemy basically give up and 2 to fight to get our alive,because his comrades will need him,the giving up option does not exist in the dictionary of the survivor or warrior,he would die trying,because if he gives up he will not only lose the battle but he will also wreck his comrades.A true survivor knows how hard it is to win a battle but he will keep fighting no matter what.Only a true warrior will be able to walk away from tho’s individuals and move forward from the pain that they have caused which is a really hard pain,a true warrior will move forward learning a lesson and getting himself everyday better,getting himself ready for the better things that will come in the future, for the light in the end of the tunnel.The people that observe from outside have no idea what survivors go through,to live tho’s things and to observe tho’s things is really different,to go through that agonizing pain no one will understand you without living tho’s things.That’s what differs a survivor from a coward,the ability to keep pushing and finding a way out to always staying alive,the ability to get himself up every time that life brings him down to his knees,while the coward gives up on the first obstacle escaping to suicidal things wrecking himself everyday until he is doomed.

Recovery from Narcissistic Abuse involves Rediscovering Who You Are at the Core. Shifting an almost addictive focus from the horrific actions, punishing venom, and heinous behavior of the abusive other back to the one who matters in this equation: You. Your Choices. Your Life. You at the Core. After the dizzying confusion, gut-wrenching reality, and the harsh realizations that come crashing down on us at the end of the toxic relationship, we need time to be validated and make sense of what happened. I know for myself I meticulously studied narcissists, psychopaths/sociopaths and abusers. I did this all to make some kind of sense of and come to some understanding of what happened to me. At some point, however, it is critical to move away from the focus on the explanations for the horrific actions of the toxic partner and put our energy into the determined work and focus that is required to heal ourselves. It is critical to peel back and make changes to our thinking and our behavior so we don’t get ourselves involved with another toxic charlatan again. After a controlling, toxic relationship, we all want to trust ourselves and our decisions again. When we start discovering who we really are and what we really want, we can step out of toxic patterns and get ourselves out of those hopeless feelings of stuck. This takes incredible strength. Having the guts to examine ourselves, our patterns, and our habits of being, is transformational, but it is hard. Many times it isn’t very pleasant. We can begin to set goals that are in concordance with OUR wants and needs and become more awake and aware of our thoughts, our emotions, and our actions. The importance of no contact cannot be underestimated. It is critical. No contact, means no contact. No social media. No texting. No searching. No reading about him/her. No contacting the “new love interest”. No “this is the last time I try to hold him/her accountable” discussions. Limit or cease contact with others who are in contact with the abuser. It is hard. It is possible. Reevaluate your “friends”. Support means support. You need folks in your corner. You need folks to listen, to empathize, to understand, and also to be there when you need the honest, compassionate truth. Sometimes the truth is hard to hear. Know who has your back. Limit or distance yourself from the friends who thrive on chaos. Begin to practice boundary setting and calm assertive communication. This difficult work requires the support of counselors, mentors, experts, and/or support groups. Healthy recovery includes the support of professional and trusted others. Practice radical self-care and limit self-soothing as much as possible. What’s the difference? A yoga class versus a bottle of wine. Care enough for yourself to take action and move forward into your new life. Care enough to rediscover who you are. With all my warmest regards. Trusting Ourselves After A Toxic Relationship | Lisa Haskins Lisa Facebook: yourlifeyourboundaries Log In or Sign Up to View

The 5 Most Efficient Ways to Recover From Narcissistic Abuse: Read, learn, and research about narcissism and abusive relationships. Be open to hearing other people’s stories, and share yours. This is a great way to heal because it lets you know that you are not alone, and that there are logical explanations for the abuse you encountered. It helps you to realise that the abuse was not your fault, and how to avoid it in the future. Quora has a great community to connect with others who often know exactly how you feel.Be open to finding healthy romantic partners. This does not mean at all that you have to find someone new to date straight away, or even a year later. All you have to do is be open to it. Being open to romance, even when not in a relationship, keeps your opportunities and horizon open to positive experiences. If you don’t believe that you can find someone better, it will never happen.I can’t stress the importance of no-contact, and completely removing your narcissistic ex from your life. This includes communication for any reason, and it is best to block them on all social media and text messaging. It is unhealthy to have the constant reminder of your ex, or to know what they are doing without you. It will only make you miss them more, and leaves the door open for them to try and get you back. Which is the last thing you want. By going no contact, you send the clear message that you no longer want them in your life.Talk about what happened with friends and family. Open up to them about how you were treated as far as you feel comfortable. It is important that friends and family know what you are going through so that they are more capable of supporting you. Leaving an abusive relationship is hard enough on its own, especially when you are facing it alone. Speak up about your abuse and don’t let it go unheard of or ignored.Write down somewhere private all of the struggles and distress you experienced in the relationship. Keep a list of everything, and ad to is as you start to see the bigger picture in that relationship. This exercise will help you to see the truth about what really happened during that time, and how much it effects you today. For example:Behaviour: My ex would always deny his abusive behaviour when confronted about it. This made me feel like I was going crazy and that I was the one to blame.Realisation: This is called ‘gas-lighting’ and is a common form of manipulation and emotional abuse in relationships. I have realised that I actually wasn’t going crazy, and that this was only another way my reality/perception was being altered.

A few weeks, you’re barely out of the woods! Healing takes time—you’re still in the stages of PTSD from the abuse you received from your ex. It’s like you escaped a death camp. First thing I would recommend is reading as much as you can on narcissitic personality disorder. You will come to see these emotional vampires are essentially walking cliches of one another. You can take solace in the similarity of stories of other survivors plus understand and reconcile there was nothing you could have done to salvage the relationship. Narcs are a miserable breed who derive pleasure in creating chaos around them thus making them feel all-powerful. That shimmering image you fell in love with was a mask hiding the true Mr. Hyde personality beneath. The more you know about the disorder, the quicker you’ll be able to spot it in others. Next, you really should find a good therapist to put you on a path where you can learn to forgive yourself for attracting this personality type into your life and putting up with the abuse cycle for so long. Your ex has successfully whittled your self-esteem to a mere nub of it’s former self. You need to build back that self-confidence and raise the bar to create a new normal in your life—otherwise, you’re doomed to find yourself in a similar relationship. I took a year off from dating seriously to do the work to educate, heal, and raise the bar permanently. In that time, I discovered three friendships that were narcissistic in nature and needed to be excised. That left the VACANCY sign on for healthy people. And guess what—one by one better people came into my life. Exiting a narcissistic relationship is only half the battle. Do the work, remain vigilant in NO CONTACT with the ex, and the fog will lift. Then you will never look back… just keep reminding yourself, you’re not heading in that direction anymore.

I have written a book which has many healing strategies. For me, after the initial shock, it was rejoining my church, talking to trusted friends, eliminating friends who were draining me, prayer, sleep meditation at night to help the nightmares, yoga and swimming in the day, writing the book, a gratitude journal, reading a lot about the disorder, having something to look forward to, planning one fun thing a week or a day and more. Here are some. SIMPLE EVERYDAY PRACTICES for Healing 1. Forest Bathing. This practice is easy to do--connect to nature, and if a forest is available, take in its atmosphere. Also walking in nature… 3. Self-Love. A statement of self-love to be said every day in addition to other ways of caring for yourself such as relaxation, eliminating negative self-talk, taking yourself out to dinner, or putting fun in every day. The statement is pledging allegiance to yourself and honoring your gifts, talents, and goodness. Commit to being loyal to yourself from now on. 4. Self-Care. This is related to loving yourself but basically means: get a good night’s sleep, eat well, exercise, and socialize with others. A good support network is also recommended. 5. White Light is essentially a protective bubble of white light that you surround yourself with in your mind. Picture yourself enfolded in a safe cocoon surrounded by angels or God as protection. This is effective before going to bed or when going into a stressful situation or when you are feeling anxious and fearful. 6. Pets. Stroking a cat or a dog can be very calming. Pets are full of good energy; in difficult times a support animal can be a Godsend. 7. Dancing, Singing, Chanting and even Drumming. It is hard to be depressed or anxious whenever you do any of these activities. They are energy movers and help to move positive energy in and toxic energy out. 8. Journaling. This can be tied into your gratitude journal or just keeping a journal of your emotions and how you have changed over time once you are out of the relationship. 9. Emotional Detachment. Maintaining a level of emotional detachment is vital for keeping stress at a distance when dealing with toxic energy. Use the Grey Rock Method when dealing with toxic people, in which you remain as boring and unemotional as a rock. 10. Being Loving. Helping a friend, volunteering, forgiving a driver in traffic that cuts you off, or saying something nice to a clerk. Start small, as forgiveness of a toxic person can take some time. 11. Living in Light. Surrounding yourself with a supportive and loving community and friends. Seeking the help of a counselor. 12. Put more joy or fun in your life. Start small, whatever pleases you in the early days of recovery. Also putting laughter in your life can be healing, even when you don’t feel like laughing. A psychiatrist has just written a book called The Transformation and he has used this on many trauma victims around the world. James Gordon, M.D. From Darkness to Embracing the Light Hope these help. Mary

For me, the process of healing took years, especially since I had had narcissistic parents, too, and had no idea what I had been dealing with all my life. I entered therapy because I had begun to dissociate when he raged. I also couldn’t fathom how he could immediately refuse to acknowledge he raged. Therapy was/is most helpful. The most important thing therapy does is to put the focus on you and your healing, and away from him and what he did/does. In fact, my therapist would not allow me to start any sentence with the word “he.” I had to start over using the word “I.” Not a bad idea to shift your focus. I also quickly learned that I had totally lost contact with my own needs, wants and desires. I couldn’t identify them; all I had left was anger and fear. Part of therapy for me was learning all over again who I was, who I wanted to be, what I wanted to feel. To shrink the fear and anger and become me again. And believe it or not, I could see and feel the fear and anger shrinking in my head. It literally felt like I could find more space in my brain for my life. It was strange. I used every type of therapy and self-help I could find to do this—I’d say try anything you think might work for you. Even just daily self-affirmations can help. That’s what therapy and self help is—positive self-affirmation. Just keep your eye out for positive ways to re-engage yourself and let positive feelings guide you. Many in abusive relationships have been weaned from friends and family by their narcissist. Once you feel stable enough, re-establish old friendships or start new. But beware of “confiding.” Most friendships, especially new ones, can’t take the place of therapy or other self-help. Even my oldest friends were disbelieving. Better to reach out to friends as companions for activities that interest you, and to simply be with those who will be happy to see you enjoying yourself. Give yourself the benefit of as many activities and interests as you want or can fit into your day. Become avid again about the things that make you “you.” Also, as a child of abusive parents, I had learned to accept abusiveness and I needed therapy to learn to see that about myself, and to learn good boundaries. You’ve taken the most important step of no contact and now you just need to broaden that to focus on moving your mind, heart and spirit away from him too. And in the process of moving away to learn enough about yourself to make your next relationship one where you look for red flags and put up safe boundaries. Good boundaries are just the result of staying present with your feelings and understanding that you have the right to avoid/say “no” to feelings of discomfort. You will be fully healed when you realize that the very instant that someone shows signs of being abusive makes you toughen your boundaries and jump ship. And before starting a new relationship it would obviously be best to be in good touch with your feelings, have strong boundaries and fully recognize red flags. Use Quora and/or very old trusted friends to “vent” if you must, but only in the short term. You’ll need to let go of looking back in order to move forward. But it never hurts to keep learning about narcissism. Knowledge is power and you never know when that knowledge might make a big difference. Also, while you are fully healing, you might find that you’d like to give someone else on Quora the benefit of your experience and “pay it forward.” So what are you concentrating on now exactly? A better relationship with yourself, for the most part. Concentrating on remembering who you really are. You are not the person he abused. That was yesterday and now you are making changes and every time you look in the rear view mirror, he’ll be farther away. We’ll all be rooting for you in your journey to full healing. Good luck. Thanks for the A2A, Cheryl.

Eliana has a very nicely laid out answer, however, let me suggest: Learn about NPD and NPD abuse so the effects of their ‘gaslighting’ can be (it’s slow unfortunately) reversed.Be open to NOT finding a romantic partner for a few years, especially the first year! Consider yourself ‘Narc Bait’! And ‘rebound’ cliches will be the least of your concern.Go ‘no contact’ yes, but then go robot (fuck you, my emotions are mine) mode. Many, many have children with these vampires and ‘no contact’ isn’t a choice, so if this is your situation (and even if it isn’t), you’re not ‘running’, you’re taking control back. The narc is all about ‘CONTROL’, and controlling THEM is as easy and understanding their absolute need for control! Simply set up a ‘gambit’ that makes them look good, manipulating them (and their ego and need for control, and you MUST keep communication emotionless and short, if you can’t best just do NO CONTACT. Now, some examples):Say, “I am glad you’re not irresponsible like this person I read about on the internet..”Never forget they’re a NARC and because you’re again feeding them ‘suppy’ they’ll be nice and ‘magic’. .Also understand you’re a CODEPENDENT and are attracted to this kind of (vampire) person. You HAVE to stay in control and in the proper ‘reality’ to attempt this.Say, “I’ve seen so many people who can’t even communicate after a divorce, it is like they have no self control. I believe it is best for us to live our own separate lives, but I’m thankful I didn’t choose a loser who has no self control” (see how we do this?)PLEASE NOTE: Manipulating a Narcissist is all about ‘sculpting’ a compliment that talks about behavior they don’t REALLY possess. Remember your ‘Archimedes’: “Give me a stick (reason/leverage) long enough and strong enough and a place to stand (respect) and I can move the world!“Reason”? - The narc wants to appear to the public even AFTER the divorce that they’re awesome and RIGHT (and even better? Good enough to be able to make peace with the ex! Use that!)“Respect?” - The narc respects people who compliment them the MOST! This is child’s play manipulating them if you choose, but don’t be fooled into believing that things can work out! You’re basically re-instantiating (computer lingo) the ‘pedestal’ stage with a different set of rules. Understand, the NARC DOES BELIEVE THEIR OWN B.S. and will (because they are) sound sincere in their attempt to win you back! IF YOU PURSUE THIS understand here and now the second time around will make the first time look like a walk in the park - imagine this is the MATRIX if you need to, notice NEO never imagined the ‘fake reality’ was real again! Consider your OBJECTIVE (it isn’t to play fairytale anymore): To make your child’s life as peaceful as possible. If no child is involved GO NO CONTACT PERIOD! Use the ‘compliment’/’Archimedes technique’ to create a framework of rules the other agree’s to because it is THEIR idea! :)**NOTE: If there was PHYSICAL violence AT ALL (believe me I know all too well the psychological violence do NOT do the above as you’re just as likely dealing with a high spectrum malignant Narc (and this won’t work) or a sociopath - they ENJOY hurting! STRICT NO CONTACT is called for. 4. *IF* you’re not ANGRY at your family (often, gaslighting and triangulation will have you at odds with your family), be THANKFUL and RECONNECT in ways you haven’t/hadn’t in years! Otherwise? Try to keep contact limited so you don’t VENT on the ones you love! 5. Write down ON PAPER! Not digital! You’ll probably send that shit to the people you shouldn’t as you’re going to want to FIGHT BACK! …AGAIN: Props to Eliana’s answer for which I just (above) ‘RIFFED’ off of. Note: Rif: To perform a monologue or spoken improvisation on a particular subject.

After a narcissistic relationship, your nervous system is surely unbalanced and you can suffer also insomnia or sleep disorder. You could also have lack of vitamins due to irregular eating and unbalanced metabolism. One key thing is to recognize that you need to calm your nerves down and one way to do that is to start being aware of the people in your life that drain your energy. And you can tell when you observe that the relationship is one-sided with one person doing all the taking, but if you need something, he would be the last person in your life to go to. This is usually a good sign that you need to create better boundaries around him. Therefore, understanding who the energy vampires are can be helpful. Here some tips for you, to improve your recovery: 1. The first key step to recovery is to begin by calming or regulating the nervous system in the healing journey. This is because if the nervous system is not functioning adequately at the optimal biological and physiological level, interventions at a psychological, cognitive, or spiritual level are probably going to be less efficient. 2. Reduce the need to please. The need to please arises generally from two motivations. The first is the fear of being unloved and the second is the fear of being without protection. 3. Shrinking the internal judge, the repository of critical messages, and the put-downs that have been accumulated over the lifetime. 4. Make your sleep cycle being in bed early and developing what is called a wind-down ritual in the evening, turning off technology, dimming lights from phones in evenings. 5. Get into the habit of eating breakfast with a sufficient amount of protein. 6. Moderate your coffee habit. 7. Keep the body hydrated by drinking enough water. 8. Reclaim your innate gift, authentic identity, and personal power. 9. Stop making the narcissist the focal point in your life. 10. Start to consider yourself as your own greatest investment. You will find more information reading these books written by Caroline Foster to help the victims of narcissists change themselves, their mindset, and lifestyle, to get rid of their toxic relationships. These books deal with the problem of narcissistic abuse by focusing on the victims and their potential for healing and self-development. For victims of narcissistic women: Narcissistic Women. The Concrete Healing Guide for Abused Men: How to Handle a Narcissist. Divorcing and Co-parenting After a Destructive Marriage. Thriving and Dating Again After Narcissistic Abuse. - Kindle edition by Foster, Caroline. Religion & Spirituality Kindle eBooks @ Amazon.com. For victims of narcissistic men: Amazon.com: Narcissistic Partner Abuse: Change Yourself to Stop Being a Victim eBook: Foster, Caroline: Kindle Store You can Download the Audio Book Version of This Book for FREE Just by Signing Up for a FREE 30-Day Audible Trial. Click one link below to get started! For Audible US For Audible UK

Since I have been abused by narcissists from the age of 4, going no contact was also the first step to my healing. All in all it took me 2 years to completely heal from narcissistic abuse (while being abused for 34 years). Depending on the severity of your narcissist abuse, the healing period/methods may vary. If it's from a relationship, the healing time will be quicker than if abused by narcissist family your whole life. Since the triggering of my buried narcissist abuse feelings (at the age of 22), my personality has been extremely volatile, in the state of volatility, narcissist family obviously didn't stop their abuse, in fact, it only grew stronger and fiercer, I always felt there was something wrong with them, but I constantly gave them the benefit of the doubt. No contact was reluctantly initiated, I chose solitude, it's in this state of solitude that you finally come to terms that your family has been mentally abusing you. In my state of solitude I was purging frightening amounts of negative energy from my soul. Daily swearing in solitude, spewing hate at the heavens and the gods, I went totally ballistic, my system was completely screwed, I literally became a wild animal. If not for my ability to suppress my volatile thoughts and actions, I would have either committed suicide, been killed or been acquitted to a mental institute. Fortunately none of the above happened. When you feel you are ready, I suggest going into inner child healing/higher self calling meditation, cause it's narcissists that disconnects you from your inner child and higher self. Oh yes, they are that powerful, don't feel bad for not loving a narcissist or giving up a narcissist family, because they have never loved you in the first place, and they have already given up on you the day you were born. In cases with narcissists, your brain will be more reliable than the heart, the heart wants from those who have deprived it of, hence you go for similar people in your future relationships, either you want to prove you are worthy of love from the same kinds of people who were similar to your narc family/lovers, or you seek out relationships with unavailable partners, just so you can have your physical needs met but with no strings attached. Narcissists are a destructive force, it's even more frightening to have them as family members, consider yourself fortunate if you can completely disown them without feeling guilt, they are not worthy of your time and effort

Get some counseling with a therapist, today you can even do it online. It helps to get you through the emotional trauma. Trauma it is definitely nothing makes you feel more vulnerable or betrayed or devastated than a narc. It is not easy to deal with at first. You question yourself what you did to cause this. You did nothing to deserve it period it happens. No one ever told us that in life you will run into some screwed up people. No one tells you how is how you deal with them. Get involved with something you love. Whether that is art or music or giving back to society. Do something you have never done before to take time away from you feeling bad. Talk to people who have been through it themselves. I used art , college work, and I did have some counseling. Work on yourself not because this happened but this develops you as a person. Forget that narc because first off the narc is a miserable person, frightened, dead inside, and never satisfied. Who wants that? They do not even want it. Heal yourself practice self love, do affirmations daily or several times through out the day. Learn from the experience do not take people who come into your life in so easily. Sad yes but when you let people in and have little or no boundaries then you are wide open for a narc. They are smart and they know just after a few conversations if you are able to be manipulated. If you are also easy to tear down. No contact is essential unless you can handle one and they are not easy. You cannot fix one either especially if other personality disorders are at play. Do not forget to be kind to yourself as well.

To me I have lived with my NPD for 46 years. I was so confused as to what was going on in our relationship. I had no experience with any emotional, physical, and verbal abuser. For me the best way to recover from a narcissistic abuse is to read everything you can on what is a NPD and how did they get that way. It wasn’t until 1995 that someone wrote on the internet on the subject of Narcissism. I absolutely had no clue or basis to understand what was going on. In my family you married for life. No one in my family supported me or could understand what I was going through. I lost friends because it didn’t make sense. Education in the field of the personality of the Narcissist is so important. Then you can understand how they became that way at the fragile age of 2–5 and developing a personality of selfishness, self-centeredness, lack of empathy, manipulation, etc., all because they have parents that were not emotionally there for them, one of their parents passed on the gene for NPD, the child was abandoned, the child was forced to become someone their parents believed and forced their child to leave who they are to become the person their parent wants them to be. Parents are not aware of what the damage they are doing to their child. But the damage is great. Eventually I hope you come to the point where you can forgive them not to their face but to yourself for their pain as young child victim just like you are an adult victim.

Get pissed off. Yep, I mean get mad and be angry! You want to recover, then stop questioning yourself wondering “why” you were treated as you were and start KNOWING that you did NOT deserve to be treated as you were. Ending a relationship with someone who has NPD is like experiencing the death of a loved one and unless you allow yourself to go through all of the emotions of the experience, you will never fully heal from it. When my husband died, I was hurt, I was afraid and then I committed the ultimate sin of being angry. I was so angry that he “left” me that I could not at the time rationalize that his death wasn’t his choice. I spent nearly a full day at his grave and I doubt anyone living has ever received a cussing like the one he got. People with NPD hurt you. You are going to be hurt, lonely, bewildered and question everything and people are going to say to just let it go and move on… NO. Get mad! If a waiter brings you a plate he just shit on, you’re gonna be pissed off, aren’t you? Well, you just got shit on by another person and you have every right to be mad about it no matter what anyone says. We are human and have to allow our emotions because holding them in damages us, not the people who hurt us and treat us wrong. When I reached the end with my ex, I left no doubt as to how I felt and why and it wasn’t pretty… but, damn it felt so good to finally get all that anger out of me and for him to hear it. That is the way to recover… let it all go by letting it all out.

Healing from narcissistic abuse requires deep work and commitment on your path. You have to understand that attraction/subjection to narcissistic abuse stems from buried/hidden inner child trauma/pain that has not been address. “Pain always attracts pain and you can never love anyone from a place of pain including yourself.” - Kemi Sogunle, Excerpt, “Beyond the Pain.” Copyright © 2014. All Rights Reserved. Be committed to doing the inner work and healing yourself.Work with a professional who can help you uncover the hidden inner child wounds to lead you to emotionally attach and trauma bond with those in pain.Recognize that you are only responsible for your journey and what you can control.Be patient and compassionate with yourself.Learn to love yourself deeply by reparenting your inner wounded soul. Embrace and affirm the inner child. Do not allow your inner critic/ego to judge you.It is okay to feel but it is not okay to sit with the feeling for too long. Examine your feelings and emotions.Learn to set healthy boundaries and remain “no contact” (no checking of social media, text, email and phone).Take back your power and voice and learn to rebuild your self-confidence/esteem.Do not allow the past to linger on for long but learn the lessons and gain a conscious awareness of who you are.Kemi Sogunle - Certified Life Coach and Relationship Expert and author of “Love, Sex, Lies and Reality,” “Being Single,” “Beyond the Pain” and “On Becoming Restored.

How does one recover from an abusive narc? (short answer→) Genuine Self Respect is the key for success. (short answer explained→) To be abused by a narc involves a great deal of low self esteem, or none at all. The lowly ‘doormat’. My mother groomed me with her VERY Nasty ways, from birth, to have NO self worth. Was always told I was a most ugly child, worthless, and such a tremendous burden daily, on my mother, she is a living saint due to her ability to deal with ALL my evil (and still be the epitome of love). My older sister and younger brother were golden children, that could do no wrong. Took me damn near 60 years to completely sever the connection with the absolute ‘ NO contact’ - from my NARC family. To recover is the tough job of understanding and realizing Genuine SELF Worth. One must learn to Love the SELF through a (new) concept called Genuine Self Respect. It is a simple idea, but most difficult to do as one has ALWAYS accepted self-worthlessness, in order to be the proper “doormat” for the narc. An entirely new mind-set of Genuine Self Respect is needed to be created in order to remove the “doormat mentality”, and the new beginning of learning to enjoy life, as a Genuine Human Being of worth, begins. Self Love is an entirely new concept needed (by the X-doormat), when one has FINALLY gotten the “balls” to go 100% ‘NO contact”, and is starting a new life FULL OF RESPECT! THAT is how I am recovering from more than 5 decades of no self esteem, by the hands of a narc parent. God bless.

What I have done besides the no contact is find new things to do like take a language class, be available to my friends more, new hair style, bought a few new clothing items and work out a bit harder. The biggest thing that I've done was to learn more about this mental illness and relax in my recliner enjoying the quiet times alone. This has helped tremendously because I'm able to learn to love myself since I'm out that debacle. I've learned what I don't need and that's all the chaos, drama and mindfuckery. I've learned that his discard was best for me now that I've worked through the initial pain of being used. I've also learned that this pain is the beginning of new times that I can now enjoy without the thoughts of being traumatized by that demonic person. So it's plenty to do, you just have to get to the place that you know you can go at it alone for now. I'm to that place of feeling good being perfectly lonely. It's a beautiful place to be, my way of getting past the abuse that worked and is working for me….try it your way on your terms and in your time.

Cutting off any way they can contact you, look at what you are doing (such as facebook, and other medias) in your life lately. Block your numbers from her, block hers from finding you, cut them out of any online way they can keep tabs on you. I went so far as to stop using face book. I set up a direct link from my Google acct so my daughter could view what I sent to her. Then you set back and develop a tough skin. It may take them months to roll back around to needing you, but it will happen. They have made the rounds with anyone else who would give them the time of day and run them out of their life, so they start over at the top of the list. Don't bite. You know the drill, and if you were smart, this time period they have been out of your life, you will have done lots of research on narcissisism. You will be able to see the signs, because they are plain as day. You have done lived thru it X times. Make this your last. They are not going to die, fall off the face of the earth or anything similar if you ignore them this time. They will find someone else, not as wise to her game. They will survive! They always have and always will

What is helping me to heal from Narcissistic Abuse is the following: being patient and kind to myself processing the many events that have caused cognitive dissonance working at a job I love Reminding myself that I can love despite having been thrown out like trash believing in myself: my inner strength was shaken but not crushed believing in God - this too shall pass. learning Big lessons about myself —wake up call. I think I am wiser from having dated a Narcissist therapy-dealing with removal of trauma. I have a good relationship with my therapist. I trust him. information and sharing experiences—this is a big part of healing having hope for my own life-) for a while I felt lost and very confused knowing that I’m not an empty shell—-i am so grateful that I am N free. No happiness for N. laughing again—even laughing about N. coming up with great book titles having good friends. Sleeping well Reconnecting with old friends and family-the ones who I feel I can be myself with. Feeling my spirit again. Believing in God. Trusting in a higher power.

I dont know how. I am still working on it. The first steps that I have taken Accept that you have been abused, manipulated and emotionally tortured. Accept that you have been a victim and make a decision not to be a victimNO CONTACT - don't contact, connect, think or obesse with your abuser. Your narc is a grandmaster of manipulation and gaslighting. It is very easy for the narc to pull you back to their drama and continue the abuse.Follow up on above, cut off all toxic people out of your life. (You likely have some) there is no need to have unhealthy relationship where you are likely to feel put down, shame or guilt. Healthy relationship only from now on.Work off your toxic shame and guilt. You mostly have toxic shame and guilt due to prolonged emotional abuseCPTSD or other emotional/mental issue(insomnia, substance abuse, depression, suicidal thoughts…….) You might have developed issues that you would need professional mental health to help you recover.Find out and identify why you were able to become “target”. Develop yourself to be a better person.

This scenario usually indicates a need for a therapist specifically trained in treating abuse victims. There are thousands of pages on Quora and probably millions online devoted to this topic, but emotional recovery is extremely hard work and could well be the most difficult thing one addresses in a lifetime. Reading about it for 10 years won’t help much because it’s not an intellectual problem or a knowledge problem. It’s an emotional problem and only therapists who have specialized in abuse and proven themselves successful should be sought. This is a long-term proposition that demands a lot of both therapist and patient. I strongly urge folks not to take this on until/unless it takes priority over all other considerations; it could take several months to several years of hard work for symptoms to abate. Anything less than 100% commitment to therapy for as long as necessary is likely to end up with disappointing results. Because of the suffering involved, some patients are offered and opt to take medication to reduce symptoms enough in order to take on the challenges of therapy; this is a highly individual decision made between patients/providers and there is no one right or wrong answer on that point. Therapy is a mutual collaboration on agreed goals and medication is part of that determination.

Realizing that it was all a really bad dream….. Take the knife from your heart, And use it as a sword. To protect yourself, from this point forward. It’s not your fault. It was not real. They do not care, how they made you feel. You were tricked. It was all a lie. Never let them see you cry. You meant nothing to them. You were used. They broke your heart. You were abused. It is over now, You must move on. Accept the fact, That they are gone. It will get better, once you get past the shock. Get them out of your head. Delete and Block. You are a good person. You did nothing wrong. They are weak! And you are strong! They were jealous of you For all that they lack. You deserve to be happy Never look back. Repeat this poem. Until you no longer bleed. Over and over, As long as you need.

It’s taken me years. But I also lost my youngest to cancer, and after that - I realized that nothing his dad (my narc) could do to me was worth my pain. Now I work hard to protect myself from his potential abuse in stealing my house, etc…But as for HIM, he can GTH. I did a LOT of reading about the subject. I started doing volunteer work (which is hard, now in the pandemic). I learned that it was/is ALL him…marriage counselors used to tell ‘us’ “It’s 50% his shit, AND 50% yours.” NO! Not w/an NPD…it is ALL their shit. They lie and deny, cheat and steal, gaslight, BLAME you and lie some more. Once you start to believe and trust in yourself, you begin to see what they are more clearly…and that helps w/healing. Know you are not alone, or stupid, or at fault. They even trick therapists, police, friends, etc. NEVER trust or believe him again. And read! Google NPD on reputable sites, like Mayo Clinic. And the best book (keep recommending it here) I have read on this is: “Why Does He Do That?” by L Bancroft. Best on the top. I read it several times, and learned a LOT! Good luck…

Obviously this can be a very painful emotional process, but it is possible. 1)Do not engage in any contact with them,no matter how much you feel you need to. 2)Remeber you were abused and emotionally manipulated by these monsters 3)Start learning to love and respect yourself, be good to yourself and those who are so in your life. 4)If your religious pray and if not closely listen to the words of the song Keisha, Praying, truly remarkable song and when you learn the history behind it, it even becomes more amazing. 5)Be patient with yourself and others in your life. 6)Revenge is not an option, it is a conscious choice to become like them when you surround yourself with evil, it can and eventually corrupt you and possibly destroy. 7)Lastly Forgive them and be at peace with yourself, but don't let them back in your life,ever again and be truthful, if you travel in the same circles

I have found meditation to be helpful in surviving. When my mind is trying to process all the mixed messages .I begin to lose trust in even my closest friends and family. At the root of my distrust is not trusting myself. Very often the victim is blamed by others. The abuser can be very charming, composed and even convince you that you are crazy and that of course everyone else thinks you are as well. If you are strong and keep the abuse to yourself, when you awaken to it, and look for support from those around you; you will often find that people will not believe you. This adds to your feelings of not trusting yourself. When I first fully awakened to the truth of the abuse, it caused a great deal of fear and self loathing. Some days I question whether or not I have become like my abuser. I feel that until I can let go of my resentment, that I am poison to other people. I fear the damage that I may have already caused and pray for peace and comfort to those I have burdened with my insensitive and hurtful behaviour. I was thinking the other day, how sad it is when we are hurt and we inflict pain on others, and I am guilty of that. I need to learn to trust myself again and in the meantime, being around people is not a good idea for me. My main point, if I have neglected to make it clear, is to be aware that when I am in pain, I am capable of causing pain to others. Healing in a safe environment is key but until that becomes possible, I find nature, art, music and my spirituality are helping me to survive. I hope anyone suffering from guilt and shame today will embrace this. Guilt is about your behaviour and shame is when you let your guilt tell you that you are inherently a bad person because of your behaviour.

A major effect of narcissistic abuse is to train you into thought patterns that serve the narcissist and not you, actually those thought patterns are intended to betray, deceive, mislead, or confuse you so that you forever remain a ready victim of the narcissist. The road to recovery involves recognizing the thought and emotional patterns in you that do not serve you, things like not honoring your own emotions, like lack of sovereignty, a cruel inner critic, which were meant to act as a harpoon for the narcissist to reel you back them. Recognizing them allows you to start fighting them. It is a fight from the inside. Expect a long journey, maybe something that can last a lifetime. If you don’t believe you are strong enough to do this alone, find someone supportive who can help talk you through it.

a few decades? you must be ready for change by now! ohhh, a couple weeks? hmmmm. well, this is what you must understand: you must LET GO and LET GOD (chemistry be used in your life). The narc is the same as the devil. the devil comes into an equation with lust, envy, hate, jealousy. it sits in boredom, sadly, pissed off. therefore: its a life equation which simply cannot build life! “LET GOD”. i know you have heard that before, but what does it mean? its really simply actually! it just means: build with others, for their hearts advancement. keep it clean, do it for love, helping, caring, all the good things of God… and THEN the equation of life which you are living within can function and you can actually grow life!! so “set it and forget it” means the same as “let go and let god”! the difference is what ingredients you use in your equation of life! 1 luv

I removed everything that reminds me of him. I forgave myself *tougher than I thought but definitely removed a lot of weight off my shoulders. I enjoy the ‘little’ silence and practice gratitude. I went back to my passion, photography, writing, helping other survivors here in quora. Started running. Started taking care of myself, would indulge in little pamper time since my ex narc withheld child support to punish me for NC. Listen to positive and feel good music. Paints with my daughter. Cooking and eating healthier. *a lot of people noticed I looked younger and more relaxed, maybe because the emotional stress is gone. Taking it easy.

Let Go: Letting go of expectations of how things ‘should be’. Letting go of one’s need to get an apology. Letting go of the responsibility towards the well being of the narcissist. In so many words stop caring about what she did/does and said/says.Consider the source: People with NPD are masters of projection and will do their best to accuse you of all the crimes they commit. To heal you need to recognize that it’s not you, it’s them.Know your worth: one thing my NPD vampires had in common was that they would do and say things to make me doubt myself as well as those who I knew loved me. But as Maya Angelou said “Nothing dims the light which shines from within”. Don’t listen to their cruel gossip and reach out to those who love you for emotional support. You can do a lot of healing yourself but the road to recovery will be smoother if travelled while holding the hand of a loved one.Good luck and much love

Best thing I ever did was educate myself regarding their personality traits so I could logically try and find my own closure…and then start to heal…. Once you have educated yourself you can start the grieving process - which is completely individual! In the meantime make sure you practice self-love, exercise, fresh air and also try and eat healthy.
